title: Monsoon Update – Rain Warning Issued for 7 States in 24 Hours, Know the Details - Times Bull
article_text:
SHARE
Monsoon Alert: Amidst the biting cold, the weather is once again changing rapidly, leading to the possibility of rain and thunderstorms in several areas. Heavy rain and snowfall in Jammu and Kashmir have already significantly lowered temperatures, making the situation worse.
Rain is expected in the plains from Punjab to Uttar Pradesh. Rain is also anticipated in other plain areas where clouds have gathered, and people have been advised to take precautions. The weather in South India also remains unstable these days.
Read More: Beware! Downloading a WhatsApp Photo Could Empty Your Bank Account. Know How to Protect Yourself
Read More: Insurance Tips – Never Make These Mistakes When Buying Insurance, Otherwise Your Family Never Receive the Money; Know from Expert Advice
Dense fog covered some areas of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar in the early morning, causing difficulties for commuters. The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a rain warning for various parts of the country. You can find detailed information about the weather in different regions below.
Rain Warning in These States
According to the Indian Meteorological Department, heavy rain and snowfall are expected in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and Jammu and Kashmir. A rain warning has also been issued for the plains from Punjab to Uttar Pradesh.
The IMD predicts that snowfall may occur in the Kashmir Valley and the higher reaches of Himachal Pradesh on January 27th. Besides these areas, light to moderate rain is expected in Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, and Western Uttar Pradesh.
Thunderstorms and winds gusting up to 40 to 60 kilometres per hour are also possible. Hail is also expected in some areas. The IMD has issued Yellow and Red alerts for several states.
Weather in the Plains
The Indian Meteorological Department predicts scattered to light to moderate rain in Punjab, Haryana, and Chandigarh. Strong winds with thunderstorms are also expected.
Lightning and winds of 30 to 40 kilometres per hour are also possible in Western Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan. The IMD also predicts that rain may continue in Eastern Uttar Pradesh on January 27th and 28th. Meanwhile, light rain and lightning are expected in some parts of Madhya Pradesh on January 27 and 28.
Read More: 8th Pay Commission 2026: Big Salary Hike Likely, Fitment Factor May Change.
Read More: Pawan Singh Bhojpuri Song “Babuaan Se Hila” With Chandani Singh Becomes Online Sensation, Must Watch
Hailstorm and Cold Wave Effects
The IMD has issued a hailstorm warning for Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, western Uttar Pradesh, and Rajasthan on January 27.  A cold wave is also expected in Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi, and Punjab, with cold wave conditions possible in some areas.
